meanings.definition: The quality of being an echo.
meanings.sent1: The echoism of the cave made the sound bounce back.
meanings.sent2: The echoism in the mountains was truly mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The echoism of the room made everyone giggle as their voices bounced around.
meanings.sent4: Her echoism was like a mirror reflecting every sound back to its source.
meanings.sent5: The echoism of the canyon was so intense, it felt like the rocks were talking back.

meanings.definition: The act of imitating or repeating someone else's words or actions.
meanings.sent1: Her echoism in class made her the best mimic in the school.
meanings.sent2: His echoism of movie lines always made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent3: The echoism of the parrot was so accurate, it fooled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her echoism was like a tape recorder, repeating everything she heard.
meanings.sent5: The echoism of the toddler was adorable as he copied his mother's laughter.

meanings.definition: A psychological condition characterized by a lack of assertiveness and a tendency to repeat the opinions of others.
meanings.sent1: His echoism in meetings often led to him agreeing with everyone else.
meanings.sent2: Her echoism in social situations made her blend in easily.
meanings.sent3: The echoism of the group was so strong, they all ended up ordering the same dish.
meanings.sent4: His echoism was like a chameleon, adapting to the opinions of those around him.
meanings.sent5: The echoism of the team made decision-making a challenge as they all echoed each other's thoughts.
